intro: Hieracium sedatum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that attract various pollinators. Hieracium sedatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
